metadata.title: CVE-2021-47150 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:fec: fix the potential memory leak in fec_enet_init() If the memoryallocated for cbd_base is failed, it should free the memory allocated forthe queues, otherwise it causes memory leak. And if the memory allocatedfor the queues is failed, it can return error directly.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47150` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-80-generic - 5.4.0-80.90~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-80-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-80.90~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-80-lowlatency - 5.4.0-80.90~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-80-generic - 5.4.0-80.90~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-80-lowlatency - 5.4.0-80.90~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1054-aws - 5.4.0-1054.57~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1055-azure - 5.4.0-1055.57~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1049-gcp - 5.4.0-1049.53~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1052-oracle - 5.4.0-1052.56~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1041-raspi - 5.4.0-1041.45~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-80.90~18.04.1').
